messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 2132
messages.msgSnippet: ... understand how ... blaming ... That is true ... *if* the person in the specific instance is, in fact, contributing to their own problems, and *if* the
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., PSoroosh@a... wrote:

> Helping someone understand themselves better - helping them
understand how
> they are contributing to their own problems - is NOT the same as
blaming
> them for getting beat up or defending the person doing the beating.
>
> --pam

That is true ... *if* the person in the specific instance is, in
fact, contributing to their own problems, and *if* the intent of the
information is actually to help someone understand themselves better,
and not transfer the blame from the abuser to the victim.

Shelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2132
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/28/2002 1:49:16 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Helping someone understand themselves better - helping them understand how they are
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/28/2002 1:49:16 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Well, while I agree that sometimes people push buttons, I believe
> that no matter what words or pestering or taunting takes place,
> pummeling someone with fists is not defensible. Period.

Helping someone understand themselves better - helping them understand how
they are contributing to their own problems - is NOT the same as blaming
them for getting beat up or defending the person doing the beating.

--pam


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
